title: ZTE joins the Science-Based Targets Initiative - ZTE
summary: ZTE Corporation has announced its commitment to the Science-Based Targets Initiative (SBTi), aiming to establish science-based emission reduction targets and achieve net-zero emissions by 2050. The company has made strides in reducing greenhouse gas emissions and enhancing energy efficiency through technological innovation. By aligning with the SBTi, ZTE intends to develop tailored emission reduction action plans across various operational domains. This step is part of ZTE's broader strategy for promoting sustainability within its operations and the wider digital economy.
green_innovation: TRUE, because ZTE is committing to science-based emission reduction targets and aims to achieve net-zero emissions, which contributes to environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE, as ZTE is introducing new operational strategies and commitments that significantly differ from its previous practices and are aimed at reducing emissions.
green_product: FALSE, because the article does not specifically mention any product that meets the definition of a green product; it focuses on corporate commitment and strategies.
green_process: TRUE, as ZTE's commitment to reduce emissions and enhance energy efficiency in its operations indicates implementation of processes that minimize environmental impacts.
product_or_process: Emission reduction targets and energy efficiency strategies
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 517911 - Telecommunications Resellers, 334210 - Telephone Apparatus Manufacturing, 541519 - Other Computer Related Services, 334310 - Audio and Video Equipment Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE, because the article presents actionable commitments and specific goals towards emission reductions rather than making misleading claims about environmental benefits.
